issue.title: Akka Http - Host Level Client Side Connection API Source.queue pattern

milestone.title: none
milestone.description: For closed issues/prs that do not belong to any release/milestone

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
Hi,
We started to implement the `Source.queue[HttpRequest]` pattern mentioned in the docs: http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka-http/current/scala/http/client-side/host-level.html#examples

This is the (reduced) example from the documentation

    val poolClientFlow = Http()
      .cachedHostConnectionPool[Promise[HttpResponse]]("akka.io")

    val queue =
      Source.queue[(HttpRequest, Promise[HttpResponse])](
         QueueSize, OverflowStrategy.dropNew
      )
        .via(poolClientFlow)
        .toMat(Sink.foreach({
          case ((Success(resp), p)) => p.success(resp)
          case ((Failure(e), p))    => p.failure(e)
        }))(Keep.left)
        .run()

    def queueRequest(request: HttpRequest): Future[HttpResponse] = {
      val responsePromise = Promise[HttpResponse]()
      queue.offer(request -> responsePromise).flatMap {
        case QueueOfferResult.Enqueued    => responsePromise.future
        case QueueOfferResult.Dropped     => Future.failed(new RuntimeException("Queue overflowed. Try again later."))
        case QueueOfferResult.Failure(ex) => Future.failed(ex)
        case QueueOfferResult.QueueClosed => Future.failed(new RuntimeException("Queue was closed (pool shut down) while running the request. Try again later."))
      }
    }

    val responseFuture: Future[HttpResponse] = queueRequest(HttpRequest(uri = "/"))


The docs state that using `Source.single(request)` is an anti-pattern and should be avoid. However it doesn't clarify why and what implications come by using `Source.queue`.

> At this place we previously showed an example that used the `Source.single(request).via(pool).runWith(Sink.head)`. 
> In fact, this is an anti-pattern that doesnâ€™t perform well. Please either supply requests using a queue or in a streamed fashion as shown below.


# Advantages of Source.queue

- The flow is only materialized once ( probably a performance gain? ). However if I understood the akka-http implementation correctly, a new flow is materialized for each connection, so this doesn't seem to be that much of a problem
- Explicit backpressure handling with `OverflowStrategy` and matching over the `QueueOfferResult`


# Issues with Source.queue

These are the questions that came up, when we started implementing this pattern in our application.

## Filtering?

What happens when request are being filtered? E.g. when someone changes the implementation 

    Source.queue[(HttpRequest, Promise[HttpResponse])](
        QueueSize, OverflowStrategy.dropNew)
      .via(poolClientFlow)
      // only successful responses
      .filter(_._1.isSuccess)
      // failed won't arrive here
      .to(Sink.foreach({
        case ((Success(resp), p)) => p.success(resp)
        case ((Failure(e), p)) => p.failure(e)
      }))

Will the Future not resolve? With a single request flow this is straightforward:

    Source.single(request).via(poolClientFlow).runWith(Sink.headOption)

## QueueSize vs max-open-request?

The difference between the `QueueSize` and `max-open-requests` is not clear. In the end, both are buffers. Our implementation ended up using `QueueSize == max-open-requests`

# What's the downside for Source.single()?

Until now I have found two reasons for using `Source.queue` over `Source.single`

1. Performance - materializing the flow only once. However according to [this answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/43015133/709351) it shouldn't be an issue
2. Explicitly configuring backpressure and handle failure cases. In my opinion the ConnectionPool has a sufficient handling for too much load. One can map over the resulting future and handle the exceptions.

It would be nice that the trade-offs for both approaches would be highlighted in the docs, so as a developer I can choose which fits my needs :)

There is also [a related stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44241920/akka-http-host-level-client-side-api-source-queue-pattern) for this. #23081 already addresses the thread-safety issue in the docs.


thanks in advance,
Muki

issue.title: Akka stream Source.queue hangs when using fail overflow strategy

labels.name: 1 - triaged
labels.description: Tickets that are safe to pick up for contributing in terms of likeliness of being accepted

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
Repro code:

```scala
val queue = 
  Source.queue[Unit](10, OverflowStrategy.fail)
    .throttle(1, 1 second, 1, ThrottleMode.shaping)
    .to(Sink.ignore)
    .run()

Await.result(
  (1 to 15).map(_ => queue.offer(())).last,
  Duration.Inf)
```

Expected behaviour: the future should end with failure
Observed behavior: the Await never returns

body: Closing this and let's investigate the other issue.

issue.title: Backport changes from Streams 2.5.5

repository.name: akka.net
repository.description: Canonical actor model implementation for .NET with local + distributed actors in C# and F#.

issue.body:
## 2.4.16 (19.11.2016 - 20.12.2016)

- [x] - [fix SourceQueue docs inconsistencies](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21877)
- [x] - [Fixed the case when identity flow appended to Source combining materialized values](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21956)
- [x] - [less noisy logging of idle-timeout (for akka-http specifically](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21989)
- [x] - [asOutput stream close race](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21896)
- [x] - [InputStream from StreamConverters.asInputStream respects read() contract](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21954)
- [x] - [Fix handling of escape sequences in JsonObjectParser](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21975)
- [x] - [add note on (non)guarantees of materializer SPI](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21935)
- [x] - [Lazy source](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21081)
- [x] - [Tree flattening should be separate from Fusing](https://github.com/kkasravi/akka/commit/73ed75a66967ca3692b9ed86775d7d81b54feb4e)
- [x] - [Fixed the bug in Attributes.getFirst(default : T)](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/21846)

## 2.4.17 (21.12.2016 - 10.02.2016)
- [x] [add Java API for NegotiateNewSession](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22280)
- [x] [fix typo in GraphStage port validations](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22062)

## 2.4.18
- [x] [fixed corruption of ordering in MergePreferred caused by using emit](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22569)
- [x] [Fail all stages on abrupt termination](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22809)
- [x] [Truncated contents in existing files for FileIO.toPath/toFile](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22807)
- [x] [Make viaMat on identity Flow preserve upstreams/downstreams](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22649)
- [x] [ClassCastException in SubSink](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22567)
- [x] [Fail framing for negative frame sizes](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22562)
~- [Failed: CompressionIntegrationSpec](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22557)~ Artery spec
- [x] [GroupedWithin cold emit fix](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22555)
- [x] [rewrite Source.empty to GraphStage](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22479)
- [x] [Fix invalid ranges in ByteStringSpec](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22392)
~~[Close Java Stream after completion](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22307)~~ Only relevant for Java
~~[fix FileIO parameter type to OpenOptions](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22770)~~ Only relevant for JVM

those three are ported in #2737
- [Don't leak sub flows when mat fails](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22647)
- [Add startPosition option for FileIO API](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22657)
- [Lazy sink wait for init](https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/22033)
